summary: Explains how to use subagents in Deep Agents for task delegation and context isolation, covering configuration, implementation, and best practices.

structure.title: Subagents
structure.summary: Explains how to use subagents in Deep Agents for task delegation and context isolation, covering configuration, implementation, and best practices.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Why use subagents?
nodes.title: Why use subagents?
nodes.summary: Subagents address context bloat by isolating detailed tool outputs, keeping the main agent focused on high-level coordination and receiving only final results.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Configuration
nodes.title: Configuration
nodes.summary: Configuration options for subagents, including dictionary-based definitions and CompiledSubAgent for LangGraph integration.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Configuration > SubAgent (Dictionary-based)
nodes.title: SubAgent (Dictionary-based)
nodes.summary: Defines subagents using dictionaries with required fields (name, description, system_prompt, tools) and optional fields (model, middleware, interrupt_on).

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Configuration > CompiledSubAgent
nodes.title: CompiledSubAgent
nodes.summary: Describes the CompiledSubAgent configuration for using pre-built LangGraph graphs in complex workflows, including its fields: name, description, and runnable.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Using SubAgent
nodes.title: Using SubAgent
nodes.summary: Demonstrates how to create a subagent for internet research using the Tavily API and integrate it into a DeepAgents system.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Using CompiledSubAgent
nodes.title: Using CompiledSubAgent
nodes.summary: Demonstrates how to use CompiledSubAgent to integrate a custom pre-built LangGraph graph as a specialized subagent within a DeepAgent.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > The general-purpose subagent
nodes.title: The general-purpose subagent
nodes.summary: The general-purpose subagent in deep agents isolates complex multi-step tasks, enabling the main agent to delegate and receive concise results without intermediate tool call clutter.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > The general-purpose subagent > When to use it
nodes.title: When to use it
nodes.summary: The general-purpose subagent is used for isolating complex multi-step tasks, allowing the main agent to delegate and receive concise results without intermediate tool call clutter.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Best practices
nodes.title: Best practices
nodes.summary: Guidelines for optimizing subagent design, including clear descriptions, detailed prompts, focused tools, model selection, and concise output formatting.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Best practices > Write clear descriptions
nodes.title: Write clear descriptions
nodes.summary: Provides guidelines for writing specific subagent descriptions to help the main agent select the appropriate subagent, with examples of good and bad descriptions.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Best practices > Keep system prompts detailed
nodes.title: Keep system prompts detailed
nodes.summary: Illustrates best practices for writing detailed system prompts in subagents, using a research agent example with specific instructions and output formatting.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Best practices > Minimize tool sets
nodes.title: Minimize tool sets
nodes.summary: Recommends limiting subagents to essential tools to enhance focus and security, with examples of focused vs. unfocused tool sets.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Best practices > Choose models by task
nodes.title: Choose models by task
nodes.summary: Guidelines for selecting appropriate AI models for different subagent tasks, with examples for legal review and financial analysis.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Best practices > Return concise results
nodes.title: Return concise results
nodes.summary: Instruct subagents to provide summaries, key insights, and recommendations instead of raw data or intermediate outputs.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Common patterns
nodes.title: Common patterns
nodes.summary: Describes a pattern of using multiple specialized subagents (e.g., data-collector, analyzer, report-writer) for coordinated workflows like data analysis and reporting.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Common patterns > Multiple specialized subagents
nodes.title: Multiple specialized subagents
nodes.summary: Describes creating multiple specialized subagents (data-collector, data-analyzer, report-writer) for a coordinated data analysis and reporting workflow.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Troubleshooting
nodes.title: Troubleshooting
nodes.summary: Solutions for subagent delegation issues, context bloat, and incorrect subagent selection in multi-agent systems.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Troubleshooting > Subagent not being called
nodes.title: Subagent not being called
nodes.summary: Solutions for main agent not delegating tasks: improve subagent descriptions and instruct main agent to delegate using task() tool.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Troubleshooting > Context still getting bloated
nodes.title: Context still getting bloated
nodes.summary: Solutions for preventing context bloat in subagents: instruct concise outputs and use filesystem for large data.

nodes.path: subagents > Subagents > Troubleshooting > Wrong subagent being selected
nodes.title: Wrong subagent being selected
nodes.summary: Addresses the issue of the main agent incorrectly selecting subagents by recommending clear differentiation in their descriptions, such as distinguishing between quick and deep research tasks.
